pros: It’s all about the culture. Team work is top notch
cons: Pay could be better but it is worth it to work with an awesome group of people

review_title: With great pay comes great responsibility
job_title: PRN RN Float Pool in Spartanburg, SC
pros: Flexible work schedule. I ended up working enough extra shifts to become eligible for benefits. Pay is by far the best that I have seen. Thrown into charge nurse positions the first time I worked on certain units with around 5 new grad nurses under me.
cons: Some units require nurses to take on step down level patients and consider them med surge appropriate quite often. I am now a travel nurse and have seen maybe 8 codes in the two years I have been traveling at other level one hospitals, 8 codes on a unit would be normal to see while working a normal 3 night per week schedule for the duration of our be month at SRHS. High acuity.

review_title: Focuses more on recruitment of new hires than retaining and valuing long term staff
pros: State Retirement Hospital Daycare Paycheck deduction to purchase in cafeteria.
cons: Pay is not fair across the board. Some people are paid for titles and others are told they don't qualify yet when you compare, things are identical. SO MUCH bureaucracy within this system. GOOD OLE BOY SYSTEM. Appears shiny from outside, but inside is corrupt. Focus on money over anything else Your voice is not heard or understood Lateral hostility happens at the senior vice president levels Doctors are not held responsible for anything therefore things reflect bad on others when you don't have any control to change it. Systemic and structural barriers are everywhere at this place. The preach one thing and do another that doesn't align. They want a bunch of sheep to work for them just say yes mam or yes sir and keep moving, don't question anything. They don't listen anyways.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Spartanburg, SC
pros: Always hours to work, no on-call shifts required for some floors.
cons: Very political, not a ton of room for career advancement. The insurance is terrible.

job_title: Senior epic application coordinator  in Spartanburg, SC
pros: Remote work is standard. Project Engineers are assigned to each project and really do a terrific job.
cons: Understaffed at the analyst level given the quantity of work. Assigned Team leads are not the norm. Epic Quarterly updates and incident tickets are prioritized over general maintenance and interface errors. Managers have no Epic access which is unusual in other hospital systems. Recently has experienced a large number of resignations and difficulty filling these openings. Upper IT mgmt. appears surprised and clueless as to why there is a retention issue.

review_title: Small hospital feel but outgrowing capabilities

review_title: I'm proud of my work and some of the people I work with, I just wish those that actually do work weren't paid unfairly.
pros: SRMC is a level one trauma center with amazing doctors and staff. We can come together to save lives and we do so everyday!! I learn daily about compassion as well as medical advancements.
cons: Management blames HR, HR won't give an honest answer but someone decided it would be smart to base pay on years experience. It doesn't matter if u are lazy and are no good at your job or if u are amazing at your job and always go above and beyond, if you have been an RN for 10 years you will be paid the same.

pros: There are no pros about this place, run away if you remotely value your beliefs and having a good life.
cons: As a staff physician for the last 5 years, I can tell you the institution does not cater to physicians.  They are focussed on protocols and always making sure that people are in line with the studer method... before that it was the fish philosophy.... and after studer it will be some other new scheme.

pros: None this is an awful place to work
cons: If you are a minority do not expect to be paid fairly.  If you did not graduate from any of the local universities, do not expect to be paid fairly.  If your not in the inner circle with some of the HR employees, do not expect to be paid fairly.  The HR fatten their own pockets and give themselves unjustified raises.  Employees with years of experience are constantly told that salary adjustments aren't in the budget or not necessary when HR professionals with little to no work experience are given top of the bracket salaries. What makes things worst is that leadership allows this to go on.  HR is suppose to be the group of professionals that ensure things are done legally and fairly.  IF you are made an offer make sure you carefully evaluate your salary based on your years experience because most likely you will be cheated.

review_title: Management are evil and cut throat, and it's very sad to see this kind of management in the Hospice field.
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Spartanburg, SC
pros: Staff that actually see the patients are great, caring people and truly are called to hospice. Decent pay. Great crew to work with.
cons: Unrealistic expectations by management. Management show favoritism, retaliate and discriminate. Management are not open to their employees to hear employees voiced concerns.

review_title: This is a transcriptionist's experience in the employ of Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System.
pros: The benefits package is very good in comparison to others in the community, above and beyond for the employee.  There are many free activities and classes offered for employees.  Tuition reimbursement program is available for education which may be used in the workplace.  Ample opportunities are made available to share opinions with management.  Equipment is adequate to excellent.  The reputation of the hospital is very good in the local community as well as statewide and nationally.  Most employees take pride in the innovations SRHS has brought to the area.  There are overall goals set and each employee is made to feel a part in achieving those goals.  The level of care the hospital provides is second to none in the state.
cons: Often, employee input is not acted upon.  Additionally, adherence to "policy" seems to be more important to management than the individual employee's situation and needs.  Policy is changed by management without notice or input from the employees, and adherence is mandatory.  Parking is inadequate and not felt to be "secure/safe" by many employees despite video surveillance.  Overall, bottom line weighs more than employee satisfaction.  Certain departments do not provide continuing education or any room for career advancement.

pros: Discounts on cell phone service!
cons: Employees are seen as equipment.  Cleanliness is subpar. Facility in high crime neighborhood.  Employee car theft is not uncommon.  Unprofessional HR department.  CEO is from Texas.  Executives highly elitist.  System focuses on marketing rather than improving morale or patient care.  Equipment is frequently broken or out of date.  Management staff out of touch with reality. Physicians are coddled-free food, mega bonuses, no accountability, perks too numerous to name.  System attempts to bleed money back out of employees via the old company store method.  Employees constantly solicited to donate to SRHS "Foundation", united way, and various other hospital related causes.

review_title: I've worked here more then 20 years and I'm fortunate to have dedicated, patient focused, caring and intelligent coworkers to share my experiences.
pros: Fair and consistent treatment of staff by leadership team. Caring and compassionate clinical team that is very patient focused and offers technologically advanced treatments for a multitude of diseases/morbidities. Focuses on wellness and disease prevention for patients as well as employees.
cons: Compensation. Pay raises insufficient for past few years.

pros: Decent benefits, competitive pay, excellent teamwork & coworkers, always learning/seeing something new
cons: Overworked, EXCESSIVE amount of call shifts to the point where having a personal life/day truly “off” is nearly impossible, consistently understaffed, micromanaged, high turnover rate, unrealistic expectations in relation to patient acuity and staffing, undervalued, lack of positive feedback, minor (almost insulting) incentives for picking up extra shifts, staff safety is not a priority for management

job_title: Digital Media Specialist in Spartanburg, SC
pros: I've had a great experience working at Spartanburg Regional. What amazes me about this place is how caring and invested every staff member seems to be. The people who work here genuinely want to make a difference, and that shows in the everyday care given to our patients. I'm proud to be part of this team.
cons: This program makes me enter 20 words to describe cons of working here. I have none to offer. That's 20!

pros: The employees are dedicated to making the best decisions for patients.  Both clinical and non-clinical staff work together to make the organization move forward.
cons: Need better IT systems and support.  Continue to promote IT awards but they don't mean anything if the network is down, the system crashes, systems can't be upgraded due to hardware issues.

review_title: SRHS is a decent place of employment, overall.
pros: Compensation seems to be fair from what I have read.
cons: Never considered for other positions, although highly qualified. Hard to get on the good side of management. They always seem to have favorites/friends who get middle management positions. Always seem to take comments/issues too personally and make a mountain out of a mole hill. Communication is terrible; there is none right now. Morale is the lowest I've ever seen it.

review_title: Well treated by management on a daily basis.
